{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient went into shock immediately after normal delivery. The relevant documents discuss different types of shock, such as hypovolemic shock, which is caused by fluid shifts out of the vascular system due to capillary endothelial damage and intravascular coagulation. Another type discussed is hemorrhagic shock, which occurs early after injury. However, in this case, the patient went into shock immediately after normal delivery, suggesting that it may be related to a obstetric complication. Amniotic fluid embolism (AFE) is a recognized cause of shock in obstetrics and gynecology, particularly after childbirth.", "answer_choice": "A"}
